sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a rectangle.
message_1: A rectangle has a length of 10 cm and a width of 8 cm. What is the perimeter of the rectangle in centimeters?
message_2:
To find the perimeter of a rectangle, you can use the formula P = 2(L + W), where P is the perimeter, L is the length, and W is the width.

In this case, the length (L) is 10 cm and the width (W) is 8 cm. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

P = 2(10 + 8)
P = 2(18)
P = 36

The perimeter of the rectangle is 36 centimeters.
